item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: 2022 New Laws Memo and Election Roundup. (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Public Education Grant Program
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed awarding of competitive WHALE TAIL grants. (AKF – SF)

subitem_title: Annual Report of the Open Space/Conservation OTD Program.
subitem_blurb: Report on status of Open Space and Conservation Offers to Dedicate Easements Program for 2019-2022. Discussion item only. (CKC-SF)

subitem_title: Interagency Agreements for Implementing California’s Coastal Zone Management Program’s Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA) Cooperative Agreement for Non-Competitive Capacity Building Award
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission authorization to enter into Interagency Agreements with BCDC and the Coastal Conservancy to transfer federal funds to these agencies for the implementation of California’s Coastal Zone Management Program’s Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA) Cooperative Agreement for Non-Competitive Capacity Building Award. (AR-SF)

subitem_title: Procurement Authorization
subitem_blurb: Commission consideration to grant authority for routine procurement to maintain operations of the Commission to the Executive Director, or designee, without further review by the Commission, when all state requirements for procurement have been fulfilled. (JC-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-21-0073-2 (Sea View Hotel Project)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on City of Malibu’s request to amend the Land Use Plan and Local Implementation Plan of its certified LCP to change the land use and zoning designation of two parcels from Community Commercial to Commercial Visitor Serving-Two, add new overlay district with special development standards for the development of new hotel; approve Development Agreement to allow increase in allowable floor area ratio from 0.15 to 0.52 for public benefits. (DG-V)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH MODIFICATIONS

subitem_title: City of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBC-22-0042-1 (Senate Bill 9)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Barbara to amend the Implementation Plan/Coastal Zoning Ordinance (IP/CZO) portion of its certified LCP to add provisions with respect to Senate Bill 9 residential density allowances is de minimis. (DG-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-21-0048-1-Part A and LCP-4-MAL-21-0049-1-Part B Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action up to one year on City of Malibu’s request to amend the portions of the certified Local Coastal Program (LCP), including (1) Local Implementation Plan (LIP) Amendment to amend sections of the LIP regarding definitions, development standards, and permit procedures related to wireless communication facilities (LCP-4-MAL-21-0048-1-Part A), and (2) a Land Use Plan (LUP) and LIP Amendment to amend LCP sign regulations (LCP-4-MAL-21-0049-1-Part B). (DG-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-STB-22-0028 (Van Wingerden, Santa Barbara County)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jill Stassinos of decision of County of Santa Barbara granting permit with conditions to Ivan Van Wingerden to allow 4.15 acres of cannabis cultivation, processing, packing, and shipping, including request to increase the height of two 15-17 ft. high greenhouses to 22 ft.; demolition of 39,739 sq.ft. of unpermitted buildings, four water tanks, and 3,240 sq. ft. of permitted greenhouse area; after-the-fact approval of 10,299 sq. ft. of accessory structures; relocate portion of dirt perimeter road to adjacent to greenhouse structures; installation of new water tanks and underground storm water detention system; expansion of septic system; fencing changes; and 1.24 acres of riparian habitat restoration at, 3508 Via Real in the Carpinteria area of unincorporated Santa Barbara County. (DC-V)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-STB-22-0065 (Pat and Maire Radis, Santa Barbara County)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Steven Kent and Nancy Rikalo of decision by County of Santa Barbara granting permit with conditions to Pat and Maire Radis, for approval of cannabis storefront retail site (dispensary) within commercial space of 3,546 sq.ft., including interior building improvements and minor changes to exterior of building, including relocation of doors and windows, as well as accessibility upgrades, new trash enclosure, relocation of entry gate, and approximately 117 sq. ft. of new additional landscaping, and including 12 onsite parking spaces, 6 of which would be dedicated (by signage posted on-site) to on-site employees and customers, located at 3823 Santa Claus Lane, in the Carpinteria area of unincorporated Santa Barbara County. (WD-V)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND

subitem_status: Postponed

subitem_title: City of Santa Monica LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-SNM-22-0041-1 (Ocean Avenue Mixed-Use Development Project). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Santa Monica request to amend the certified Land Use Plan to modify the development standards for 11 lots bounded by Santa Monica Boulevard and Ocean Avenue and allow approval of the Ocean Avenue Mixed-Use Development project. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

item_title: Items W15C  and W15D below will share a single, combined public hearing.

(KT-LB)

(SA-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. item_title: Items Th12b and Th12c will share a combined hearing.

subitem_title: City of Dana Point LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-DPT-21-0059-5 (Dana Point, Doheny Village).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action regarding City of Dana Point’s request to modify and add provisions to the Land Use Element of the General Plan and Zoning Ordinance, both of which are components of the City of Dana Point Local Coastal Program, commonly known as the “1996” LCP.  The purpose of this amendment is to preserve and enhance the eclectic combination of commercial, light industrial, and residential mixes uses in the Doheny Village area.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-22-0003-3 Part A (Accessory Dwelling Units).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Laguna Beach to amend provisions of the Municipal Code with new regulations for accessory dwelling units in zones that permit residential uses. (BW-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-22-0003-3 Part B and C (Local Coastal Development Permit Procedures).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Laguna Beach to amend provisions of the Municipal Code with updates to  local coastal development permit procedures to correct clerical errors, modify time extensions, and authorize administrative actions to bring local permits into conformity with Commission-approved permits (BW-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

El Camino Real, Unit 76, San Clemente, Orange County. (SA-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: County of Humboldt LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-HUM-21-0067-3 (Accessory Dwelling Units).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by County of Humboldt to amend each of the County's six Land Use Plans and the Implementation Plan to update regulations for accessory dwelling units (ADUs) and junior accessory dwelling units (JADUs) in compliance with State law. (MBK-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-22-0049-1 (Cannabis Regulations Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Eureka to update the LCP Implementation Plan provisions of Articles 7, 8, 9, 10, 29, and 30 related to cannabis licensing, enforcement, events, and uses allowed in the Commercial Waterfront (CW) zone district and other zone districts, and if the Commission does not take final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (TRG-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-22-0054-2 (Digital Sign Prohibition).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Eureka to update the LCP Implementation Plan provisions of Articles 17 (Signs) and 22 (Nonconforming Uses, Structures, and Signs) to (1) prohibit new digital signs in all zone districts and (2) ensure that existing nonconforming digital signs adhere to the specific standards for brightness, message display, and design, and if the Commission does not take final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (TRG-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-MEN-22-0014 (Caltrans, Mendocino County)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Albion Bridge Stewards and Co-Appellants Maria Hansen, Miguel Elac, Jim Heid, Bill Heil, Arlene Reiss, Warren De Smidt, Annemarie Weibel, Ali van Zee, Janet Eklund, Tom Wodetzki, and Jacob Patterson from Mendocino County decision granting permit with conditions to Caltrans for the Navarro Ridge Safety Project, including but not limited to: increasing roadway travel lanes to 12 ft.-wide, increasing paved shoulders to 4 ft.-wide, installing Midwest Guardrail System, replacing drainage facilities, and removing up to 75 trees along approximately 0.52-mile-long segment of Highway 1 near Navarro Point (Post Miles 41.78-42.3; staging at PM 42.4), between Albion and the Navarro River, Mendocino County. (AL-A)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND

subitem_title: Application No. 1-18-0630-A1 (Trinidad Civic Club & Trinidad Rancheria, Trinidad)
subitem_blurb: Request by Trinidad Civic Club and Cher-Ae Heights Indian Community of Trinidad Rancheria to amend original permit authorizing in part the temporary placement of Trinidad memorial lighthouse and fog bell in Trinidad Harbor to allow for permanent siting of lighthouse and bell in same location adjacent to harbor parking lot, to elevate lighthouse on raised concrete foundation with maximum structure height of 25 ft., and to construct concrete wall, steel railing, pedestrian walkway and concrete pedestal to support bell, two observation benches, historic anchor, lighting, and utility connections, located in Trinidad. (DC-A)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. subitem_title: City of Capitola LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CAP-22-0037-1-Part B (SB 9 Housing Provisions).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Capitola to modify its LCP to implement Senate Bill 9 related to lot splits and residential density allowances is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-22-0058-2 (Septic Systems).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by Santa Cruz County to modify the LCP’s onsite wastewater treatment system requirements is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (NC-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Monterey County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-MCO-22-0062-2 (Highway 156).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by Monterey County to amend the LCP’s coastal resource protection requirements to allow for construction of a highway interchange and other public safety improvements at the intersection of State Highway 156 and Castroville Boulevard, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (SD-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Public Works Plan No. PWP-3-MCO-22-0002-1 (Monterey County Resource Conservation District Forest Health and Fire Resilience Public Works Plan)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on RCD’s proposed Public Works Plan that would allow a 10-year vegetation treatment program designed to enhance ecosystems and improve wildfire resilience (in tandem and pursuant to the State Board of Forestry's certified California Vegetation Treatment Program Programmatic Environmental Impact Report) within the Monterey County coastal zone. (DN-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-STC-22-0070 (St. Joseph Senior Housing Facility, Santa Cruz)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Anne and Robert Segal of City of Santa Cruz decision granting permit with conditions to merge five lots into two, demolish two vacant school buildings, construct 76-unit senior housing development, and related development at former Gateway School adjacent to Shrine of St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lighthouse Field State Beach at 126 Eucalyptus Avenue and 136 Pelton Avenue, Santa Cruz. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: No Substantial Issue

subitem_title: Application No. 3-23-0014 (Grossman Armoring, Pismo Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Gary Grossman to authorize construction previously completed pursuant to emergency CDPs G-3-20-0025, G-3-21-0023, and G-3-21-0035 (to fill a 70-ft. long, up to 27-ft. deep, up to 6-ft. high sea cave with 73 cu. yds. of shotcrete and construct new 83-ft. long, 18- to 24-in. wide, and 5- to 9-ft. high contoured and textured cutoff wall); to allow additional new armoring (install three new up to 83-ft. deep tiebacks; to remove up to 20 cu. yds. of upper bluff soils and add new shotcrete facing over new 400-sq.ft. area); to install new bluff area drainage apparatus and landscaping; to repair upper bluff shotcrete (previously installed pursuant to CDP A-3-PSB-02-016); to authorize after-the-fact nine soil nails embedded some 30 ft. into bluff without benefit a CDP in 2005, all located on and in the bluff, at toe of bluff, and on beach seaward of 121 Indio Drive, Sunset Palisades area, Pismo Beach. (KB-SC) (Note: The Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and/or this site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS
